Omnisphere combines many different types of synthesis into one amazing-sounding instrument that can spark a lifetime of exploration. In this article, we will explain what Spectrasonics Omnisphere is, what VSTi.RTAS means, what a torrent file is, and how to install Spectrasonics Omnisphere 1.5.6d VSTi.RTAS (Windows Mac OS) UPDATE ONLY [2011] (AiR).torrent on your computer. What is Spectrasonics Omnisphere? Spectrasonics Omnisphere is the flagship synthesizer of Spectrasonics, an award-winning company that creates innovative software instruments for professional musicians. Omnisphere was first released in 2008 and has since been updated several times with new features, sounds, and enhancements. The latest version of Omnisphere is 2.8, which was released in 2020. Overview of Omnisphere features and capabilities Omnisphere is a hybrid synthesizer that combines various forms of synthesis, such as wavetable, granular, FM, additive, subtractive, sample-based, and physical modeling. It also has a powerful modulation system, an arpeggiator, a multi-effects processor, a live mode, a stack mode, a browser, and a sound lock feature. Omnisphere has over 14,000 sounds in its core library, ranging from classic analog tones to modern digital textures. You can also import your own audio files or use the built-in sound sources to create your own sounds. Omnisphere supports up to 8 layers per patch, each with its own oscillator, filter, envelope, LFO, and effects. Omnisphere is compatible with most DAWs that support VST, AU, or AAX plugin formats. It can also be used as a standalone application or as a ReWire device. Hardware Synth Integration and Hardware Sound Library Hardware Synth Integration also unlocks the Hardware Sound Library, which is a collection of over 1600 new patches for Omnisphere that are inspired by the sounds of the hardware synths. These patches are organized by hardware models and categories, and can be easily accessed from the browser. You can also use the Hardware Sound Library as a starting point for creating your own sounds, or mix and match them with other sounds in Omnisphere. Vastly Expanded Synthesis Engine and New Sound Sources Omnisphere 2.8, the latest version of Omnisphere, introduces a vastly expanded synthesis engine that adds four new types of synthesis: wavetable, granular, harmonic, and innerspace. These new synthesis modes offer new possibilities for sound design and sonic exploration. Wavetable synthesis allows you to morph between different waveforms in real time, creating dynamic and evolving sounds. You can use any of the hundreds of wavetables included in Omnisphere, or import your own wavetables from Serum, Dune 3, Massive X, or other sources. Granular synthesis allows you to manipulate audio samples at a microscopic level, creating complex and organic sounds. You can use any of the thousands of samples included in Omnisphere, or import your own samples from any format. You can also use the granular engine to process live audio input from your microphone or other sources. Harmonic synthesis allows you to create rich and harmonic sounds by manipulating the partials of a waveform. You can use any of the basic waveforms included in Omnisphere, or import your own waveforms from additive synthesizers such as Razor or Harmor. You can also use the harmonic engine to analyze and resynthesize any sound source in Omnisphere. Innerspace synthesis allows you to create immersive and atmospheric sounds
